job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-07-09T20:02:44.000Z", "description": "

Must Haves:

\u2022 At least a Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field (or equivalent experience)

\u2022 6+ years of experience in software development

\u2022 Fundamental knowledge of Object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem-solving and complexity analysis.

\u2022 Proven skills in C# and JavaScript (preferably VueJS) and two or more of the following:

\t\u27a2 TypeScript, CSS, SQL

\u2022 The ability to communicate with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.

\u2022 Demonstrated willingness to learn new technologies and in solving challenging problems.

\u2022 The ability to think abstractly and deal with ambiguous/under-defined problems.

\u2022 The ability to learn and adapt quickly to changing requirements.

 

Pluses:

\u2022 Experience building complex multi-tier software systems and or services

\u2022 Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

\u2022 SQL Server development skills including data integration, data modeling, query performance tuning, designing stored procedures

\u2022 Experience with Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) in applications, especially smart card credentials

\u2022 Experience with ORM technologies like Entity Framework, Dapper, or NHibernate

\u2022 Experience with development in a Windows environment using .Net, Active Directory, IIS, Remote Desktop Services etc.

\u2022 Experience with web-based applications, both local and cloud

\u2022 Familiar with cloud solution stacks from either AWS or Azure

\u2022 Experience with windows services, microservices, docker, containers

\u2022 Experience writing, documenting and consuming REST APIs, GraphQL, etc

\u2022 Familiar with development using Secure Software Development Lifecycle standards

 

Day to Day:

You work in a fast-paced environment where you will develop and deliver software that simplifies solutions for a broad set of interrelated problems. Specifically, you will join a talented team of dedicated professionals in delivering production-quality code against well[1]drafted requirements and business logic from product management. You will have the opportunity to create and deploy cutting edge solutions for commercial and government clients alike. Best of all, you\u2019ll get to grow your experience working alongside smart people to solve problems that make the world a safer, more efficient place.

 

What does a typical day look like for the Software Developer?

Although no two days will be the same, you\u2019ll:

\u2022 Participate in high functioning software development projects including design and test

\u2022 Interpret requirements and design specifications to develop, debug, test and maintain

software applications to be deployed against a broad array of platforms and cloud services.

\u2022 Maintain current knowledge of relevant technology

\u2022 Proactively manage relationships with other team members

\u2022 Present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of

audiences.

\u2022 Facilitate consensus building and resolution of complex technical issues

\u2022 Present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.

\u2022 Be an active participant in your development along your career path
